Hippocampus regio inferior of Cajal.Definition: One of two cytoarchitectural division of hippocampus proposed by Ramon y Cajal consisting of a large-celled proximal region of the hippocampus proper.  This region corresponds to CA2 and CA3 in the nomenclature proposed by Lorente de No (Adapted from Paxinos, G. The rat nervous system, Ed 2, Academic Press, San Diego, 1995)
